message.body: Hi LDCTalker, how's it going today?
Good! how are you?
Not too bad. I was kinda surprised by the cold ride into work this morning though.
Yeah the only thing that is good about this cold is imagining how burning hot it will be in a few months.
Since graduation was yesterday, I wonder if that means the official start of decent traffic.
Yeah things in the garden are struggling now due to the cold, but in a few weeks they will probably be scorched by the sun.
Yeah and shorter lines at magic carpet food truck!
Oh yeah! I forgot about that truck. I have a friend who calls it "street meat" so I have to block that out when I go.
That's great you have a garden. My garden is called "Trader Joes".
I don't know why anyone would call Magic Carpet street meat, it's all vegetarian and vegan food
I use that garden too!
Oh - just food trucks in general she calls "street meat".
I like the produce stand on 40th at the end of locust walk.
I swear one time I bought some bananas there the size of a loaf of bread. It was crazy.
That makes sense
Yeah there is another produce truck on 44th a little farther down locust st by the Supreme. I go there on my way home sometimes
Sorry not on locust , sansom st
My poor ipod touch is dying.
I guess they are only built to last a few years
I went to the apple store for a fix. I've been in apple stores before, but somehow it was like a .. what's the word
Hydroponics. It was like they were growing electronics in there and getting the customers high.
Unless its still covered by AppleCare I take my Mac stuff to springboard electronics. Way cheaper
Is that the place on walnut?
Yes I think that's the location but I've never brought an I pod there just my laptops
What's the issue with the iPod?
The home button is stuck a bit. I've done some things I've seen online (alcohol, plug tweaks) and it has helped some.
(1/2)It overheats and the battery life is low. I should probably factory reset it, but I'm lazy and don't feel like reinstalling the apps, even though I only
That makes sense. What apps on it do you use?
Mostly games but I have netflix on there as well. I'm looking at getting an iPhone when the next one comes out. What apple products do you have?
Some old iPods and a mac book and an iPhone
I have a galaxy s2, so I guess we should be fighting and wrestling.
I wish I just had my old flip phone, it was cheaper, smaller, the battery lasted longer and I didn't worry all the time about loosing or breaking it.
I've heard that a lot!
Plus after like 2 years you can't update the OS on an iPhone so you basically can't use the apps after that.
Oh really? Why is that?
Or do you mean you can update it, but the device can't handle the new OS so it is basically a brick?
I hear that is how iPhones are designed so you basically have to get a new one after two years.
So do use ur iPod to play games when you commute?
Fruit ninja is fun though
I play Draw Something sometimes but took it off my phone because I was wasting my life.
What kinda stuff do you do in your free time?
I usually play the games while watching tv. It doesn't have internet so I have to tether it to my s2 if I'm going somewhere.
Oh yeah, I forgot
I never could get into fruit ninja. Or tiny wings. I do have all the angry birds though, and that's just as bad.
I usually watch tv, exercise a bit, and play word games. Now that the weather is better I'll probably shop more. How about you?
What apps do you have?
I just have apps to take photo and video and share them and some tools like a level and flashlight.
I'm trying to stay away from games because they will take over my life
I have some podcast apps and YouTube and a language translator
Haha :D. I used to have that level app. Still hung pictures crooked.
Yeah it's not very sensitive.
I guess the app that is most important for me is google maps
And weather app
I have a friend who grew up in a warm climate. So weather means nothing to her.
It's like, wake up, walk outside. No thought of a coat, umbrella, anything. It's so interesting.
I grew up in central ny so I always have to check
It would always be raining or snowing or both at the same time, from different directions.
Eww.
I definitely wanted to go to college further south
I thought this thing gave us a topic? Guess not.
No we can talk about whatever we want. Cars, food, dragons, austerity measures...
What do you think about that a la carte Cable bill?
I don't know about it, what is it
It would let people pay for just the channels they watch.
Instead of big groups of channels.
It sounds like it could be good but may limit the variety of shows a person watches. That part could be bad.
I don't have cable so it doesn't really apply to me. I would like to have HBOs streaming subscription though
You watchi Game of Thrones I'm guessing.
I saw the first two seasons and thought they were pretty good.
I was thinking I wish they'd change the intro as the territories change/places get conquered.
But I never read the books.
I didn't read the books either. Have you seen any of season 3 yet
Yep. The opener was so boring it has tainted my appreciation for the last few eps.
I forgot to even watch it on sunday. And now I kind of don't care.
Though I did hear about the scene at the end.
That's too bad, most of the first two seasons were cool. I didn't really like the dragon girl and that plot line but other than that I thought it was pre
tty exciting.
I wanted to see more of the white walkers and the people who live north of the wall.
I actually like her storyline. I like Tyrion and Arya. I could do without the winter walkers.
That explains why the show has such a mass appeal I guess. It has at least one plot line or character for everyone.
I think that the CGI dragons really made me dislike that plot line because up until that point the show had little CGI and felt like a really amazing historical drama.
The CGI dragons just felt a little bit like Harry potter or something
That's a great point.
I do love when media does it the old, long way instead of just resorting to cgi. CGI looks so cheesy when it is something imaginary.
And there are so many instances when they use it unnecessarily. Have you seen that video that shows all the times it is used in films?
The violence felt more Shakespearian before the dragons and more fantasy after, to me anyway.
I have not seen that video
How do you find it
I'm looking for it now - I can't seem to find it.
Well I like stop motion animation over cgi any day
